intro: Cephalaria ustulata, commonly known as the scorched cephalaria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually gray-green and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Cephalaria ustulata produces small yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
